alert.note: Alert for Hockley; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 24 at 6:26PM CDT until May 24 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN HOCKLEY, SOUTHERN LUBBOCK, NORTHERN LYNN AND NORTHEASTERN TERRY COUNTIES... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lubbock, Levelland, Slaton, Wolfforth, Ransom Canyon, Slide, Woodrow, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Texas Tech University, Downtown Lubbock, Reese Center, Meadow, Wilson, Smyer, Buffalo Springs, Ropesville, New Home and Lubbock Science Spectrum. The heaviest rain extends along a line from McAdoo to Crosbyton to points south of Ralls and Lorenzo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
